head.title: National Briefing | South: Florida: Hotel Is Sued Over Carbon Monoxide

hedline.hl1: National Briefing | South: Florida: Hotel Is Sued Over Carbon Monoxide
hedline.hl2: Florida: Hotel Is Sued Over Carbon Monoxide

abstract.p: Iowa family that fell ill at Doubletree Grand Key Resort in Key West, Fl, nearly week before man who stayed in same room died of carbon monoxide poisoning, is suing hotel (S)

block.p: An Iowa family that fell ill at a Key West hotel nearly a week before a man who stayed in the same room died of carbon monoxide poisoning has sued the hotel, claiming they were injured. David and Jody Smith and their son Nathan, of Ankeny, Iowa, stayed at the hotel, the Doubletree Grand Key Resort, and were treated at a local hospital on Dec. 21, less than a week before Thomas Lueders, 26, died from inhaling carbon monoxide fumes that came from a boiler adjacent to his room. The Smiths' lawsuit seeks compensation for hospital expenses and emotional anguish. Ira Leesfield, the lawyer for the Smiths, said he expected at least three other families to join the suit.

The Smithsâ€™ lawsuit seeks compensation for hospital expenses and emotional anguish. Ira Leesfield, the lawyer for the Smiths, said he expected at least three other families to join the suit.
